column23: To the Shareholder of DPA Microphones A/S
column26: The Annual Report is prepared in accordance with the Danish Financial Statements Act.
column27: In our opinion the Financial Statements and the Consolidated Financial Statements give a true and fair view of the financial position at 30 April 2016 of the Company and the Group and of the results of the Company and Group operations and cash flows for 2015/16.
column30: The share capital consists of 10,400 shares of a nominal value of DKK 100. No shares carry any special rights.
column31: Current tax liabilities and receivables are recognised in the balance sheet as the expected taxable income for the year adjusted for tax on taxable incomes for prior years and tax paid on account. Extra payments and repayment under the on-account taxation scheme are recognised in the income statement in financial income and expenses.
column32: Dividend distribution proposed by Management for the year is disclosed as a separate equity item.
column33: Financial asset investments, which consist of unlisted shares and deposits, are measured at cost at the balance sheet date.
column34: Administrative expenses comprise expenses for Management, administrative staff, office expenses, depreciation, etc.
column35: Prepayments comprise prepaid expenses concerning rent, insurance premiums, subscriptions and interest.
column36: Distribution expenses comprise costs in the form of salaries to sales and distribution staff, advertising and marketing expenses as well as operation of motor vehicles, depreciation, etc.
column37: Financial income and expenses are recognised in the income statement at the amounts relating to the financial year.
column38: With reference to section 32 of the Danish Financial Statements Act, revenue has not been disclosed in the Annual Report. Gross profit/loss contains revenue less production expenses recognized as specified below.
column39: The item âIncome from investments in subsidiariesâ in the income statement includes the proportionate share of the profit for the year.
column40: Provisions are recognised when - in consequence of an event occurred before or on the balance sheet date - the Group has a legal or constructive obligation and it is probable that economic benefits must be given up to settle the obligation.
column41: Receivables are measured in the balance sheet at the lower of amortised cost and net realisable value, which corresponds to nominal value less provisions for bad debts. Provisions for bad debts are determined on the basis of an individual assessment of each receivable, and in respect of trade receivables, a general provision is also made based on the Companyâs experience from previous years.
column42: Cash and cash equivalents comprise âCash at bank and in handâ and âCurrent asset investmentsâ. âCurrent asset investmentsâ consist of short-term securities with an insignificant risk of value changes that can readily be turned into cash.
